results.title: Ciliated thought
results.brief_description:
This project is based upon an exploration of themes and imagery from the novel “Bend Sinister” by Vladimir Nabokov.
Fragments from a story about love and loss…among other things.

results.title: Cigarettes and matches
results.creator_credit: Jerry Elder Productions and Jerry Elder
results.brief_description: Based on a chapter from the book “The Sun on the Stubble” by Colin Thiele. Evokes the Australian country and the people of the 1920’s by highlighting the relationships between members of a farming family and their friends. Cast includes Michael Moody, Timothy Edwards, Hetty Rollings, John Remynse. Suitable for primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Cigarette smoking
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Single Concept Drug Films”.
This film shows the increase in cigarette smoking in the United States of America since World War I and how this increase has led to a large jump in the incidence of lung cancer. It also shows other diseases directly attributed to cigarette smoking.

results.title: Cigarette blues
results.creator_credit: Dallas Museum of Art, Flower Films, Les Blank and Alan B. Govenar
results.brief_description: As Texas blues singer Sonny Rhodes performs a song about a lover who died from smoking cigarettes, the film shows a sculpture made entirely of butts from the cigarettes which eventually killed the sculptor, Louis Bunce.

results.title: Cicero: the queen's drum horse
results.creator_credit: BBC, Jack Le Vien, Terence Dudley and Kevin Connor
results.brief_description: A heartwarming and highly entertaining film tells the true-life story of the horse now known as Cicero, which is now in the forefront of Britain’s royal parades bearing the Queen’s silver drums. Tracing Cicero’s “rags to riches” adventures from Ireland to Scotland to England, the film culminates in the stirring pageantry of the annual Trooping the Colour.

results.title: Cicada
results.creator_credit: Division of Motion Pictures Extension Service
results.brief_description: The life cycle of the cicada, or, as it is commonly known, the seven-year locust. In spring, the pupa emerges. Time-lapse photography shows us the transition from pupa to winged insect, including the shedding of the pupal shell. The winged insect lays eggs, from which young insects hatch and drop to the ground to begin their underground larval stage of development. In the spring, they will emerge in the pupal stage, and the life cycle will commence again. Narration by J.A. Hyslop.

results.title: Ciao! Manhattan
results.creator_credit: Court Pictures, Robert Margouleff, David Weisman and John Palmer
results.brief_description: Initially filmed in 1965 “Ciao! Manhattan” was an experimental film made on a miniscule budget with a counter-culture underground tone, starring the ‘superstar’ and ‘it’ girl of the Andy Warhol Factory scene - Edie Sedgwick. Filmmakers John Palmer and David Weisman, aware that their 1960s footage did not amount to a comprehensive narrative, decided to continue filming several years later, cobbling their 1960s work together with new scenes, introducing the story of Butch - a 1970s drifter who picks up a topless and disoriented woman (Susan) hitchhiking. Delivering Susan to her eccentric mother’s mansion, Susan occupies an empty swimming pool and surrounded by Edie paraphernalia, the couple relive Susan/Edie’s heyday. Edie essentially plays herself as Susan, a beautiful rebellious heiress who models for Vogue, hangs with the famous artists and iconoclasts of her time and represents the look and mood of the silver sixties. In the seventies portion of the film she is past her prime, damaged by excessive drug intake, reliving her former glory whilst lolling around topless and occasionally making sense. As a conventional feature “Ciao! Manhattan” barely holds together, the disorderly history of its production undermining notions of a cohesive structure. But the story of Edie Sedgwick, encapsulated within the extensive footage of her at both ends of the spectrums of her life, is fascinating. Sedgwick died several months after the production completed. Cast includes: Roger Vadim, Viva, Paul America, Isabel Jewell, Brigid Berlin and Baby Jane Holzer.

results.title: Ciao Federico!
results.brief_description: This is a hour spent in the company of Frederico Fellini, unarguably one of cinema’s greatest figures. American filmmaker Bachmann was given unequalled access to the Maestro and his medium, following Fellini around during the shooting of “Satirycon”. Fellini displays all the attributes for which he was famous; he cajoles, implores, abuses and torments his cast and crew, behaves one minute like a tyrant and the next like a baby, displays grace and charm, and on occasions a touch of genius. It offers a fascinating portrait of Fellini at work.

results.title: Churchill: voice of a prophet
results.creator_credit: Nielsen-Ferns, New York Times Productions and Don Thompson
results.brief_description: Examines Churchill’s life immediately after the Second World War and his loss to Labour in the general election; his predictions of the dangers of the Soviet Bloc; his anti Soviet speeches throughout the USA; his visits to India in 1947 for the granting of independence; his return as Prime Minister in 1951 and his death in 1965. Narrated by Henry Fonda. Suitable for upper secondary level.
